resources.string: We are looking for your schedule in the depths of hell (on ASPU servers)

What do you want to report?
Describe the situation in more detail
Alas, you don\'t have any saved groups…

You scroll through the weeks too fast with the schedule…
A new version of the app is available!
You will be redirected to google maps
Restart the app to apply the theme

DAY OFF.

Looks like someone has a day off today…
It's time to think about rest and enjoy the beauties of this world…
God, let me close this session!
You got an easter egg! Go to settings!
You must grant permissions to access this feature.

This application was developed by a student of the Armavir State Pedagogical University of his own free will for the benefit of others.

If you are reading this, then I will tell you about this wonderful application.

I, the developer of this miracle, worked tirelessly for a year to write a convenient application for displaying the current schedule.

The content of this application does not aim to offend or offend anyone, all media content of the application is in the public domain and does not violate copyright, if you think that this is not the case, write about it in the feedback form.

The source code for the application is on my github account, which can be accessed from the side menu.

The application only collects data about the technical characteristics of the device to ensure greater compatibility.

By installing this application, you automatically give me, the developer of the application, your consent to take a loan in your name at no charge. Joking aside, I didn't get a penny for the apps. Everything was done for students and teachers, everything for the sake of convenience and of course everything is free.

Naturally, there will be no ads in the application, no one wants to see ads on the floor of the screen while viewing the schedule.

With you, in the data immortalized in the code, I was Artem Mikhailovich Oganesyan. Thanks for using the app.
To view the record book, enter the login and password of the EIOS AGPU
